comment: a lot of homework and discussions

Was probably going through one of the hardest semesters of my college career while taking this class. Professor Butcher was really understanding especially with it being a short burst summer class and I couldn't thank her enough. The summer course was heavily focused on discussion posts and papers. We did a skit, infographic, and final paper.

Dr. Butcher was amazing. She was extremely understanding of us still going to school during a pandemic and was always available and returned emails promptly. Participation was required but it never felt like a burden. Paper and discussion post heavy but the material wasnt hard. One of best professors Ive had here.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Butcher made the class interesting. She requires a lot of work, but its doable if you can manage your time well. There was an online group simulation which was fun if you get into it. Take her if you can!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Best professor ever!! Lots of essays, midterm/final is an essay, and 8-10 research paper due at the end of the semester. She truly cares about her students and is very reasonable and flexible. All the assignments are manageable just turn them in on time. Not the toughest grader but gives really good feedback.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: This wasnt a synchronous class. Very easy to get through. Weekly assignments due. A couple papers throughout the semester but very manageable. Shes an incredible professor and very passionate! I highly recommend to anyone who can take her. This was my second class with her and still love her teaching! Def take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Prof Butcher is a really great teacher. She's super kind and respectful of everyone and their opinions and views. Her tests are written exams but she gives out study guides with everything you need to know.

Overall a very knowledgeable and pleasant instructor. If you're polite, she's pretty flexible and will try and work with you if you have any time conflicts. I would avoid her 8-Week summer course, it seems like she just takes the normal semester long course and crams into 8 weeks. Lots of reading and 3 5-8 page papers. Makes you work for your grade
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Butcher is AMAZING! Everyone should get the chance to take her class. She is knowledgeable about IR. I loved this class so much. There's a group online simulation but it is easy. She's lecture heavy for sure but it is interesting every time. Her tests are reasonable too, not too hard and not super easy. She's also really funny and approachable.

Easy A if you're good with keeping up with online work. Weekly papers 1-5 pages, journals, midterm/final long paper but, you can use the online lecture to write the whole thing. The online lectures are really interesting and she is a lenient grader. There's an extra credit assignment for the end, and rounds final grade. Make sure not to miss work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Overall, she is a good teacher. I took her 8 week class online during the summer. Every week we had a module, which had 2 discussion posts, 2 peer responses, a writing assignment, and a test. Her writing assignment were not bad only 3-5 paragraphs. Most of the questions on her tests were on quizlet, but she only gives you 25 mins
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She cemented the reason I chose to major in International Affairs. The textbook was super interesting, but it was necessary to read before class because she would often give pop quizzes or mini-essays to test our knowledge before we learn the material in class. There's also a simulation that if you get into it, is really fun and interesting.

Highly overqualified and very knowledgeable about the subjects she teaches. I took her for online for Intro to Int'l Relations and decided to take her the rest of the way for any courses she teaches. She's an amazing teacher who really has a passion for her career. Classes are easy, IF you're willing to listen to what she has to say. Lot of writing
Very easy to work with, flexible, concise and really makes you think about the reasons our country does things that don't make sense. She is also very nice

Took online during the summer. ALOT of reading. Discussion posts were easy. Quizzes And tests were fairly short. Definitely remember what you're reading. Overall an easy A if you stay ahead and do your work before its due. The readings are quite dry though.

Took online. Every 2 wks per module was nice. Content and grading were challenging. 8 modules consists of 2 discussion posts+2peer responses, 1 quiz, 1 essay. No midterm or final, just the models. She does provide a fair amount of feedback in essay grades. 25 minutes per 20 question quiz (I think). Be ready to dedicate a lot of time to this one.

I took her online.  Assignments were due every 2 weeks.  This included a writing assignment, test, and discussion board for every module (8 modules).  She's a pretty cool teacher and she does explain how to improve on your writing assignments when she grades them.  The book is surprisingly interesting. Overall, a great teacher.

She is very nice and seems to want everyone to do well. There were a lot of writing assignments and a lot of reading. Although she does not take attendance and attendance is not mandatory she does give graded in class assignments every class so it is very important to actually go to class.

Took her for Introductory Political Science a few semesters ago. As stated previously she isn't very clear on grading papers, but if you are a flaming left wing Liberal you're guaranteed an A. Class is very boring, mostly reads from powerpoint slides. Tests are fairly straight forward, but she is very biased in grading papers. Do not take

The material is on international relations, so the people who are whining about her politics cannot shake the "fox news syndrome!" If you drop your domestic mentality and adopt an international approach, you will succeed in this class! The material does allow the partisan politics of America to influence  international relations!

Dr. Butcher is an easy going person who wants the best for her students. Her syllabus was set for you to comprehend the material and not just for memorize it on test day, so alot of reading is required.
Nice person, bad grader. She is very critical at grading and you must participate online even when there is no class. She needs to lighten up.
She is a great teacher. My only complaints are that she grades too harshly for a 2000 level class and her pitch gets pretty loud in class.

She is extremely clear in what she wants and very responsive. It seemed like an excessive amount of work, but then there is an excessive amount of content to cover. 1 quiz, 1 paper and online discussion board every week, a midterm and a final. Tough class, but learned a lot. Would absolutely take a class from her again!

Great Professor. Must read for class. Threatens to call on people but never does (although she should!). Discussions are great if people have read. Will play devil's advocate if no one voices the other side of an argument. Papers are graded on grammar, spelling, etc, which is a little much, but otherwise, Great professor.

Took for two classes. Extremely boring.  Very strict (ie allowed 2 absences. I missed the first day, during drop add and she counted it)..tests are very difficult..grades tough on papers.  The only saving grace is the high number of assignments: 3 tests, 1 paper, and a simulation.  The simulation is very easy and the paper isn't too bad..

This is a good teacher...and she really makes understanding American Governemt easy...however she requires a lot for general ed class. I would take her again though because she knows her stuff! 3 tests, 2 papers weekly, online quizzes & weekly discussion posts. And everything is EASY!! Attendance is mandatory however just have someone sign you in!!

Not an easy class. 3 tests and 2 papers. Gives about 150 definitions as a study guide and only tests you on 4 of them and uses this rather than study questions. Grades extremely hard on papers and tests are very difficult. Only good thing is she is very lenient about people making up tests and papers.

Lectures were so boring. We had to write two papers and she graded them so difficultly and said they were "specific" enough. Three tests, which were hard, even if you do the study guide. The study guide was awful because all it is is defining 130+ bold face words from the book. I would not recommend taking her; she made a 1101 class way to hard.

DO NOT TAKE. Tests are based off power point lectures that are given everyday and the book. Not too hard. But absolutely horrible when it comes to grading essays. Do not expect to do well in her class just because you've done well in every other class you have ever had.

Possibly the worst teacher I've ever had. She grades your essays and contradicts herself... it's like she doesn't pay attention. She wants blunt and simple, not a decent writing ability. Extremely boring. Unreasonable work loads for time allowed. Obviously a new teacher. Ridiculous attendence policy. I DO NOT recommend.

You need TB if you want an A in the class you can make a B/C if you chose not to buy one. 3 test and 2 papers. Participation is 10% Test are only on BOLD words in book. She gives a study guide before each test with all the words that might be on the test but the test only contains around 40words out of  130+. Talk in class your grade will improve.

She counts you late if you are 5 minutes late. Tests are hard study guides are reallyyyy long. She lectures off a powerpoint everyday nothing new. She grades very hard on the paper assignments and the tests are medium hard.

Boring class,a lot of discussion and note taking. The test are from the book and bold words. 2 papers and attendance is mandatory. Very possible to earn an A if you put forth the extra work. No HW Take if you most.

straightforward..let's you know what to expect. read and participate is really all she asks. tests come straight from ppt and book. two short papers (2 pages). highly recommend. unless you are the whiny sort who expects a grade for doing nothing.
A very nice woman. She really loves the subject & I recommend any class taught by her.
Very straightforward. Doesn't stray far from the text; doing the reading isn't necessarily mandatory, as she goes over it all in class anyway.
